title: Kenya Moore's claims Marc Daly had 'multiple affairs' during marriage
text:
The Real Housewives Of Atlanta star announced her split from husband Marc Daly on Thursday, September 19 in a statement where she revealed she 'can no longer continue in the marriage.'

And the split was due to Marc having 'multiple affairs' during their two-year marriage, according to an Us Weekly insider.

'She walked away from her career for him and he had no problem with that and no problem disrespecting her,' the outlet's source said.

The 48-year-old Real Housewives Of Atlanta star revealed that her marriage was over in a statement she released on September 19.

Kenya said: 'It is with profound sadness that I regret to inform my fans that I am divorcing my husband, Marc Daly.'

Adding: 'Due to recent and ongoing circumstances, I can no longer continue in this marriage. My sole concern and focus is and will always be my daughter, Brooklyn, my miracle baby.'

Adding: 'She was made in love and true commitment. I ask for our privacy to be respected moving forward.'

Strength: 'She walked away from her career for him and he had no problem with that and no problem disrespecting her,' the outlet's source said; pictured with their daughter Brooklyn in Greece

Kenya and Marc tied the knot in June 2017 after dating for less than a year; they welcomed their daughter Brooklyn on Sunday, November 4, 2018.

She opened up about going through IVF with Marc and eventually getting pregnant with daughter Brooklyn in O, The Oprah Magazine.

The reality star told the magazine that in her early 30s she began experiencing extreme pain, later finding out it was due to fibroids.

Family time: Kenya and Marc tied the knot in June 2017 after dating for less than a year; they welcomed their daughter Brooklyn on Sunday, November 4, 2018

Mom and dad: She opened up about going through IVF with Marc and eventually getting pregnant with daughter Brooklyn

Kenya said that she had to have several surgeries to remove the fibroids from her uterus - called myomectomies.

After one of her procedures, she was told that it could affect her uterus if she ever wanted have a baby.

'It was actually one of my nurse practitioners who told me, "At some point, your uterus will not recover from all of this,"' she said in the interview.

Explaining that scarring and the damage from the removal surgery would make it difficult for her to ever have children.

At age 40, Kenya decided to to get assessed for her fertility at a clinic, where she did two tests and found out she can have kids on her own or via IVF, but she wanted to wait until she was with someone she wanted to have a child with.

She married Marc at age 46 and then tried to have a baby on their own but then turned to IVF; the first try failed but the second one was a success and she got pregnant with Brooklyn.

Kenya joined RHOA in season five but left after season 10 concluded, following her marriage; she was just a guest star in season 11 but returned to the main cast for season 12.

Real Housewives Of Atlanta is set to return to Bravo for season 12 on Sunday, November 3.
